original_title: Sri Lanka to revise National Savings Bank Act to make bank more competitive
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sections of the National Savings Bank Act No.30 of 1971 are to be amended to facilitate the bank’s functions in a competitive financial market, a cabinet statement said.
“The National Savings Bank has found it difficult to cope with the competitive and rapidly changing financial market due to the limitations existing in the National Savings Bank Act No.30 of 1971.

“Therefore, in order to maintain a sustainable development for the institution, certain sections of the Act should be revised, with the objective of further extending monitoring activities of the bank through identifying new business opportunities and developing a new enterprise structure.”
This week, the cabinet approved a resolution instructing the legal draftsman to prepare the amended draft bill. (Colombo/Dec21/2023)
